abstract: Fabio Fognini and Simone Bolelli defeat Nicholas Mahut and Pierre-Hugues Herbert in Australian Open, becoming first all-Italian team to win men's doubles title since 1959.
lead_paragraph: Fabio Fognini and Simone Bolelli became the first all-Italian team to capture a men’s doubles title in a Grand Slam event since 1959, beating the Frenchmen Nicolas Mahut and Pierre-Hugues Herbert, 6-4, 6-4, in the Australian Open final in Melbourne.
